ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Speaking of lower levels...
ygData.msgSnippet: What I used to do in early final (and it would probably work on any new server) is team up with a master smith.  I d order armor in bulk.  Bunches of tunics,
ygData.messageBody:
What I used to do in early final (and it would probably work on any new
server) is team up with a master smith. I'd order armor in bulk. Bunches
of tunics, pants, helmets and capes (hardest pieces to get stuff of) of
Medium size. I'd get this stuff in Freeport for about 1pp/AC. Then I would
run to Qeynos and sell them for 1.5pp/AC. I would give 'credit' on sales
to regular customers as well. I raked in about 100pp profit per trip and
could do 2 trips a day and sell about 20-30 peices. The market dries up
after about 2 months as everyone is twinking newbies at that point.

But it's still not a bad concept ;)

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Jeff Heskett" <tarkin@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, April 17, 2000 5:50 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Speaking of lower levels...


> the worst orders are the ones where you ask 20 times "are you SURE you
want
> a gorget? a spiked collar would probably be a lot better and cost as much"
> they reply "sure sure, full suit"
>
> then an hour later running back and forth from misty thicket to HH because
> you're making small and you run to EC and finally show up after a bunch of
> impatient tells and he says "Oh! i just need a tunic, legs and cloak now.
> how much for those 3?"
>
> hehe ulcers coming back to me from this. i charge 1000pp to make a full
> suit of banded now. very effectively tells people i've hung up my
> sledgehammer.
>
> but there is something to be said for being able to create actual armor
> (that isn't half bad) from your own hands.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
> Sent: Monday, April 17, 2000 2:59 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Speaking of lower levels...
>
>
> As a Master Smith on the Karana server it is just not worth my time or
> effort to make and sell Banded anymore. As most people are not willing to
> pay enough to make it worth while. That combined with too many flakey
> customers, last 2 people who wanted a complete set flaked on me after I
had
> made it, have led me to stop making banded for sale. The only time I make
> it now is for friends that need it.
>
> Rokenn
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
> > Sent: Monday, April 17, 2000 11:55 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Speaking of lower levels...
> >
> >
> > I don't know about banded being unprofitable...Shamans
> > need it for totemic armor and there are usually a few
> > people making it, I think it's rare because the skill
> > required to make the stuff takes a long time to build.
> >
> > I got most of my bronze (just upgraded) from a 43rd
> > lvl magician camping Einhorst in the Barb village in
> > WK.
> >
> > But up until this week I had a full set of banded.
> >
> > WK might be a good place to buy bronze cheap since
> > it's so heavy and Einhorst apparently drops quite a
> > bit of it.
> >
> > Tyunes of Rodcet Nife
> >
> > --- Papa Legba <legba@...> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Dragoon Dirk
> > > > Shining Star of Light
> > > > Avenger's Battleaxe
> > > > Mistmoore Battledrums
> > > > Banded armour (and what level should we upgrade to
> > > bronze)
> > >
> > > Dragoon Dirk: 40P
> > > Banded Armor is usually less than 1P per AC. Bronze
> > > is normally 1+ a
> > > bit per AC.
> > > If you can carry it, skip banded and go right to
> > > bronze. Its cheap
> > > enough now, and no one makes banded anymore (since
> > > its so unprofitable)
> > >
> > > --
> > > We now return to the non-stop rock.
> > >
> > > Matt DeBarger
